embed.description: A young Demacian mage has a secret she must hide - not just from her family, but the entire kingdom. Music: Bassnectar - "Butterfly (feat. Mimi Page)" https://bassnectar.lnk.to/butterfly More from the Animation Workshop: Miss Fortune: Surrender - Her back's to the wall. Bad luck for them.

replies.body:
This is really beautiful. It reminds me a lot of Glen Keane's work. He's most famous for being a very talented Disney animator/character designer. (He designed the Beast, Tarzan, Rapunzel, etc.)
Here is one of his best works, the one that reminds me the most of this Lux short.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O9CG_PoEWCg
good catch Ink rose.  You are right on the money.  This IS Glen Keane.  It was a huge humbling experience working with Glen.  His insight into the craft of animation goes so beyond common thought.

Oh wow! I'm surprised that I got it right, I guess being a Disney animation nerd helps though :P
 That is a really great collaboration of artists, It's cool seeing different kinds of art (game art + classical animation art) come together like this. :)
Glen Keane really inspires my artwork and character designs, I love seeing his creative touch now influencing League.
Holy crap that is awesome.

Hey you guys have talked about how far off a live action movie would be but have you guys given any thought to doing animated movies or miniseries of the direct to video sort? DC comics does that, and they kinda suck but the model seems like something that could work.

> [{quoted}](name=Zippolious,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Q6EcqpAA,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-05-19T18:54:15.498+0000)
>
> good catch Ink rose.  You are right on the money.  This IS Glen Keane.  It was a huge humbling experience working with Glen.  His insight into the craft of animation goes so beyond common thought.

I don't know if anyone who works with Riot will see this, but I want to know what it was like to work on Lux: Binding Light. I'm doing a project for school where we have to debunk an initial belief by the general public (in this case, that this animation is 'bad') and show that it is totally NOT the case. I'm always fascinated and amazed by the animations Riot does, from the animation workshop to the music videos (so many different animation styles. . . you people are insane), and I really want to show how difficult and amazing it is to produce an animation of this caliber. Or any animation in general. AND LUX: BINDING LIGHT IS PRODUCED IN FREAKING CELL TOO!!!! JUST HOW??????

It _should_ remind you of Glen's work...because it is. You're looking at Glen Keane's inspired and intimate vision of Lux.

(Glen doesn't work at Riot, but he accepted our invitation to play around in the League Universe, and we're stoked that he did.)

Please please please continue collaborating with different artists/animators/musicians like this! His animation + Lux + Bassnectar, such a gorgeous mix. I am so stoked to see what you guys have in store for us! Honestly it's the animations and art that are a big factor in me buying skins to support Riot so that you guys can continue to put out amazing art!
Cool! Was he asked to make a Lux animation in particular, or did he choose her?
This would have been beautiful in full CG. The storyboards don't do it justice.

I have to resist the temptation to try and take on the project.  I _really_ want to clean it up and add in colour, but that would involve disappearing off the face of the earth for the next few months while I worked.
Do it.
Can you please??? It would be soooo worth it!{{champion:99}}
I shall think on it at the least.  If I do work on it I would probably have to do it over the summer since I have final projects coming up.

Completely understandable! I've tried learning some animation through classes and teaching myself but it's just soooo not for me, so I get the work that would have to go into it.

Do you happen to have any of your work on youtube or something if you dont mind sharing?

Nope lol.  I originally wanted to be an artist and then I got into programming.  I decided programming was a better career path and that art was a better hobby.  As such art is something I do in my free time, so I try very hard to keep it separated from anything work related.

I am also very good at copying styles and don't have one of my own to stick with.  I can replicate pretty much any style if I spend a few hours working with it (other than cartoon for some reason) but I am not a very self motivated artist.  It all adds up to me not being self motivated to make art very often and possessing a preference to building off other people's ideas/works.

Fun and all but nothing that would make good content for others to watch, plus attending a programming/animation school and having had art oriented friends around me made me a bit self conscious when it comes to posting anything that isn't just joke art.

So no, I don't really have a collection of art anywhere, and most of the art that I do keep on is just stuff that I worked on to pick up a new style out of boredom.

-----------------------------------------

It does make me good at stuff like this though since I have a base to work with and I can quite easily fill in the missing frames with a highly similar art style which is why I kinda want to do it.
I still got chills even though it wasn't a full blown cinematic.
Same, even though I didn't like it that much. Maybe I can understand Lux, that's why.

Am i the only one failing to see what's so special about this being done by Glen Keane? I don't mean disrespect and i can certainly see it's artsy style but i don't see how it's much different from other animations that look like they're drawn as a sketch.

I don't know him so care to explain, someone?
He's a renowned artist at animation, each movement is used to emphasize the beauty in itself. He doesn't waste a frame.
I see..although i can only assume he draws each frame differently then because Lux's appearance changes as she moves. So he treats each frame as a painting in it's own right.
TAAAAAAAAAAAAAKE ONNNNNNNNNNN MEEEEEEE

Beauty in simplicity.

Good work, all the animations so far are really well though and realized, it's nice to have a window peek at the champions characters.

This is so pretty! It's really well done, and I am in awe of the video. Thank you Riot for having this made, and sharing it us! All the emotions really hit home. {{champion:99}} you mess with my feelings today in the best possible ways?
So... Will all champions get an animation one day? Would be awesome :')
Wow, unlike for the Miss Fortune's animation, im actually amazed by this one :D Why my main cant have an animation this good? {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Who's next after this lux video?

I sense a pattern, choosing the 'poster children' for each faction in runeterra maybe? Miss fortune for Bildgewater, Zed for Ionia, Darius for Noxus, Lux for Demacia...

I'm hoping for a Mt.Targon with Diana!!!!!!!!!...Or..leona whatever, or a Piltover one showcasing vi's big punches :OO

>Who's next after this lux video? I sense a pattern, choosing the 'poster children' for each faction in runeterra maybe? 

No see this is where some from the community are misleading themselves. 

If it wasn't obvious enough, these past four videos are unrefined passion projects. That means there is no _"pattern"_ among the particulars of the champs depicted or even which champs will be represented next. The fact that they are _"poster children"_ is purely coincidental. Plus the previous three videos had a teaser for the next animation and now with Lux's release there isn't one. So I'm to assume that means there wont be any more.

I would honestly think Ahri is more of a poster child for Ionia than Zed. 

A Vi one would be fantastic, I feel like we don't see enough of her and I don't even play her.
This is one of my favorite things you guys have ever created. Her personality shines through perfectly in this video.

Omg, and they used Butterfly by Bassnectar! <3 One of my favorite musicians mixed with one of my favorite champions! 

RITO <3 <3 <3
